div.l: ¶ Her begynnyth the Cokis prologg
The Cook of london̄ while þe Reve spak
For Ioy he thoght he clawid hym on þe bak
Aha ha quod he for Cristis own̄ passioun̄
This Miller hath a sharp conclucioun̄iconcluciouiconclucioun̄
Oppon his Argument of herbegage
Wel seid Salamon̄ in his his langage
Ne prese nat every man̄ in to thy house
For herburing be nyght is perlouse
Wel oght a man avisid for to be
Whom̄ that he bring in to his pryvite
I prey to God so ȝeve me sorow ⁊and care
Syn̄ evir I hight hogg of ware
Herd I myller bet I set a werk
He had a Iape of malis in þe derk
But God for bede þat wee styntyn̄ here
And therfor yf yee vouch save to here
A tale of me that am apore man̄
I wol ȝewe tel as wel as evir I can̄
Alitil Iape that fil in our͗e Cete
Our͗e hoost answerd and seid I grᵃaunnte it the
Nowe tel on Roger loke þat it be good
For many apasty hast thowe lete blode
That hath be twyis hoot and twyis cold
Of many apilgrym̄ hast þowe Cristis curs
For of thy persele ȝit fare þey þe wers
Nowe tel on gentil Roger be thy name
But I prey the be nat vroith for game
A man̄ may sey ful soth in game ⁊and pley
Thowe seyst ful soth seid Rog̉er be my fey
But soth pley que ad pley as þe flemmyng seith
And therfor harry bally be thy feith
Be þowe nat vroith or we departyn here
Thogh that my tale be of an hostelere
But nethirlese I wol nat tel it ȝit
Or wee depart I wis þowe shalt be quyt
And ther̉e with al he loghe ⁊and made chere
And seid his tale as yee shul aftir here
